rev.desc.rev.desc: Need to add a new category name to both the category table and the imcategory table in PD environment
Nullsubbed the journal.pm.order so that updates made via events will be recorded and time stamped.
Took out the hard code referrencing 'SCAutomate' from the panels reopen, update and close

modified the expressions on the update panel to take into consideration the settings for journalled updates in the environment record. The action will get inserted or appended depending on the journalled updates setting. See the task for the SCR to see more specifics on updates.

Removed $acttime=str(tod())+":" from the start panel. Added this to a new process panel called set.action.time (called from set.time.zone). Allows for the timezone to be modified BEFORE the $acttime variable is set.
Set up operator query on start.

"i solved the issue by having it query for the event user, default to external if no user was given, and then nullsub with what was in the company record. then set the timezone to whatever i got. i have attached my unload."

The stamp on the update and close actions always uses the tod() function. In the case of data migration, the tickets are really old sometimes, yet the timestamps use the current time so it looks like tickets closed in 1997 were last updated in 2000. This isn't a big deal, but the customer did complain. I added this line
to the close, reopen and update panels (using reopen.time and update.time for reopen and update, of course) to make the stamp the same as the time the action actually happened.
A new panel called check.axces.add that is being called from select.probsum when more than one record is found.
Modified build.query panel to error out of the app when a problem open is requested with an invalid category.
Corrected condition where an error message was being generated even thought the record processed.
Added scmsg function for internationalization of messages.

descript.descript: Need to add a new category name to both the category table and the imcategory table in PD environment
Nullsubbed the journal.pm.order so that updates made via events will be recorded and time stamped.
Took out the hard code referrencing 'SCAutomate' from the panels reopen, update and close

modified the expressions on the update panel to take into consideration the settings for journalled updates in the environment record. The action will get inserted or appended depending on the journalled updates setting. See the task for the SCR to see more specifics on updates.

Removed $acttime=str(tod())+":" from the start panel. Added this to a new process panel called set.action.time (called from set.time.zone). Allows for the timezone to be modified BEFORE the $acttime variable is set.
Set up operator query on start.

"i solved the issue by having it query for the event user, default to external if no user was given, and then nullsub with what was in the company record. then set the timezone to whatever i got. i have attached my unload."

The stamp on the update and close actions always uses the tod() function. In the case of data migration, the tickets are really old sometimes, yet the timestamps use the current time so it looks like tickets closed in 1997 were last updated in 2000. This isn't a big deal, but the customer did complain. I added this line
to the close, reopen and update panels (using reopen.time and update.time for reopen and update, of course) to make the stamp the same as the time the action actually happened.

Modified build.query panel to error out of the app when a problem open is requested with an invalid category.
Corrected condition where an error message was being generated even thought the record processed.
Added scmsg function for internationalization of messages.
